Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: ミーシャ
Entry.EnglishText: Misha

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: キュリア
Entry.EnglishText: Curia

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア兵
Entry.EnglishText: Callegean Soldier

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: 食材屋「ママのスープ」
Entry.EnglishText: Grocer

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋「だんらんの館」
Entry.EnglishText: Innkeeper

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋
Entry.EnglishText: Inn

Entry.JapaneseText: ノルゼン
Entry.EnglishText: Nolzen

Entry.JapaneseText: ノルゼン・宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Nolzen - Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>さん！ 今すぐ、 <Eugene>さんのところへ!!
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>! We need to go to <Eugene> right now!

Entry.JapaneseText: どうした、ミーシャ？
Entry.EnglishText: What happened, Misha?

Entry.JapaneseText: さっきの兵隊さんが、 かなり危険な状態です！
Entry.EnglishText: That soldier we met earlier is in critical condition!

Entry.JapaneseText: あの兵士が？
Entry.EnglishText: He is?

Entry.JapaneseText: キュリア先生は他の患者さんで 手一杯で、今は<Annie>さんしか 頼れる人がいないんです。
Entry.EnglishText: Dr. Curia is busy taking care of other patients, so <Annie> is the only one who can help him right now.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>、急ごう！
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>, let's go!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>さん、急いで!!
Entry.EnglishText: Hurry up, <Annie>!

Entry.JapaneseText: キュリア先生、遅いですね。 何かあったのかな……
Entry.EnglishText: Dr. Curia is taking forever... I wonder what's taking her so long...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そうだったの……なんて、 うなずけない話ばかりね。 聖獣だの<Blue>思念<White>だの…… にわかには信じられないわ。
Entry.EnglishText: I see, but... It just sounds so outlandish. The Sacred Beasts, the <Blue>Will<White>... I find it all hard to believe.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、全部ホントなんだよネ。 少なくとも、いきなり種族の対立が 激しくなったのは間違いないでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: At the very least, you can't deny that these racial conflicts are growing more intense all of a sudden, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: それはそうね。 でも……種族の対立って、 その<Blue>思念<White>だけのせいなの？
Entry.EnglishText: I suppose that's true, but... Is that "<Blue>Will<White>" really the sole cause of these conflicts?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……まあ、いいわ。 とにかく、船が必要なのよね。 軍にかけ合ってみるわ。 ちょっと待ってて。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Well, no matter. You need a boat first and foremost. I'll see if I can't work something out with the army. Wait here just a moment.

Entry.JapaneseText: お願いします。
Entry.EnglishText: We really appreciate it.

Entry.JapaneseText: 失礼します。こちらに いらっしゃると聞いて参りました。 <Eugene>・ガラルド隊長で いらっしゃいますね？
Entry.EnglishText: Pardon me, I'm stopping by because I was informed that you were here. You are Commander Eugene Gallardo, are you not?

Entry.JapaneseText: 確か、街の入口にいた…… 俺を知っているのか？
Entry.EnglishText: You're the one we met at the town entrance... How do you know of me?

Entry.JapaneseText: 以前、正規軍の戦闘訓練に 隊長が参加された時に、 指導していただいた事があります。 隊長は、自分の目標でした。
Entry.EnglishText: I once had the privilege of receiving your instruction when you participated in the general army's combat drills. I really looked up to you, commander.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……それで、俺に何か用か？
Entry.EnglishText: ...So, is there something you need from me?

Entry.JapaneseText: いえ、ひとこと、ごあいさつを 申し上げたかっただけです。 あの事件さえなければ、隊長は……
Entry.EnglishText: Ah, no, I merely wanted to stop by and say hello to you. If it wasn't for that incident, you would still be...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなた、あの事件の事を…… お父さんの事件の事を知ってるの!?
Entry.EnglishText: "That incident?" Do you know something about my father's death?!

Entry.JapaneseText: 隊長、この子は……!?
Entry.EnglishText: Commander, is she...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ドクター・バースの娘だ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...She's Doctor Barrs's daughter.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……すみません、 余計な事を…… では、私はこれで……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Forgive me, I said something I shouldn't have. I'll be taking my leave...

Entry.JapaneseText: 待って、事件の事を聞かせて！ どうして父は殺されなくては ならなかったの!?
Entry.EnglishText: Wait, I want to ask you about what happened! Why did my father have to be killed?!

Entry.JapaneseText: どうして教えてくれないの!? わたしに知られたら、都合が 悪い事でもあるというの!? ガジュマ同士、かばいあうつもり!?
Entry.EnglishText: Why won't you let him tell me? Will I inconvenience you in some way by knowing the truth? Are you Gajuma all just covering for each other?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……かばいあう？ 何を言っているんだ？ 隊長はむしろドクターをかばって！
Entry.EnglishText: ..."Covering for each other?" What are you talking about?! Eugene is the one who is covering for Barrs!

Entry.JapaneseText: この人が父をかばった!? どういう事なの!?
Entry.EnglishText: He's covering for my father?! What is that supposed to mean?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ドクターがラドラス様を……
Entry.EnglishText: Barrs was responsible for King Ladras's...

Entry.JapaneseText: よせ！
Entry.EnglishText: Enough!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……すまない、帰ってくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: Sorry, but you need to leave.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……も、申し訳ありません…… ですが、隊長……忘れないでください。 あなたを信じている者がいる事を…… ……失礼します……
Entry.EnglishText: ...My apologies. But please, Commander, never forget that there are people out there who believe in you. Now if you'll excuse me...

Entry.JapaneseText: 先生、遅いですね。 何かあったのかな……
Entry.EnglishText: Dr. Curia is taking a while, isn't she? I wonder if something happened.

Entry.JapaneseText: 様子を見てくる。
Entry.EnglishText: We should check up on her.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Eugene>？ どこへ行くの？
Entry.EnglishText: ...<Eugene>? Where are you going?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……少し、外で 風に当たって来る。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I'm just going to step outside for a moment to get some fresh air.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……<Mao>、気づいたか？
Entry.EnglishText: You've noticed it too, haven't you <Mao>?

Entry.JapaneseText: うん……
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah...

Entry.JapaneseText: なに？
Entry.EnglishText: Noticed what?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>の様子が おかしいんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: There's something off about <Eugene>.

Entry.JapaneseText: おかしいって？
Entry.EnglishText: Off how?

Entry.JapaneseText: うまく言えないが…… どこかが以前と違うんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: It's hard to describe, but he's acting different than he did before...

Entry.JapaneseText: ボクも……何か悩みみたいなものが あるのかなって思ったけど、 なんとなく聞きづらくって……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't describe it, either... It seems to me like something's bothering him, but I can't bring myself to ask...

Entry.JapaneseText: 聞かれても、あんたに 話すとは思えないけど？
Entry.EnglishText: Even if you did ask, I'm not sure he would tell you.

Entry.JapaneseText: ボク、信用ないのかな……
Entry.EnglishText: I guess he doesn't trust me...

Entry.JapaneseText: そういう事じゃないわ。 いわゆる年長者としての 意地と威厳ってヤツよ。
Entry.EnglishText: That's not what I meant. He's just got that stubborn sense of dignity that comes with age.

Entry.JapaneseText: そういわれてみると、 <Eugene>って、自分の事は 全然、話してくれないよな。
Entry.EnglishText: Now that you mention it, <Eugene> is pretty tight-lipped when it comes to talking about himself.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたはしゃべりすぎだけど。
Entry.EnglishText: Says the man who talks too much.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>……
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……コレ見て!!
Entry.EnglishText: ...Guys, look!

Entry.JapaneseText: 能力者!?
Entry.EnglishText: A Force User?!

Entry.JapaneseText: それも、かなり強いヤツだヨ!!
Entry.EnglishText: And a strong one, at that!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……まさか<Blue>四星<White>？
Entry.EnglishText: Could it be one of the <Blue>Four Stars<White>?!

Entry.JapaneseText: うーん…… むにゃむにゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: Mmmh... Zzz...

Entry.JapaneseText: この兵士はだいぶ よくなったみたいだな……
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like this soldier is doing better.

Entry.JapaneseText: こ、この音は 一体、何……??
Entry.EnglishText: What's that sound...?!

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの息子、出かけたきり、 戻ってこないんですよ……
Entry.EnglishText: My son went out, but he hasn't come back...

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 食材を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Ingredients Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: あの子…… どうしたのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: What could have happened to him...?

Entry.JapaneseText: あの子…… 大丈夫かしら……
Entry.EnglishText: I hope he's all right...

Entry.JapaneseText: 疲れたら宿も 利用してください。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're tired, feel free to stay at our inn.

Entry.JapaneseText: 保存状態、最高の 食材をそろえています。
Entry.EnglishText: We've got the finest ingredients, perfectly preserved.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマが いがみ合うようになってから、 息子はヒューマを恐がって……
Entry.EnglishText: My son's grown afraid of Huma ever since they started getting into fights with Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: 種族の事なんて気にしてたら 宿屋なんてできないよ……って 何度も言ってるんですけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I've told him over and over again that if he gets caught up in this race stuff he won't be able to run an inn, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>幻の庭<White>が見つかったら、 ぜひ、そこで採れた野菜を ウチに卸してくださいな。
Entry.EnglishText: If you actually find the <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White>, I'll buy up any of the vegetables you find there.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「幻の野菜」があるなら、 食材屋として黙っていられない ものね……
Entry.EnglishText: How could I ever pass up the chance to sell "Illusory Vegetables?"

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>幻の庭<White>……さて…… 聞いた事ないですねえ。
Entry.EnglishText: The <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White>...? No, I've never heard of it.

Entry.JapaneseText: もしそんな場所があるなら、 そこで育った野菜は「幻の野菜」に なるのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: But if it did exist, I'd love to know what sort of illusory vegetables would grow there...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマのお仲間と 旅をしているなんて、 今時、珍しいわね……
Entry.EnglishText: You don't see Gajuma traveling with Huma much these days.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、以前は当たり前のように みんな仲良くしてたのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: It used to be a given that everyone was able to get along...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……しばらく前までは、 この街のガジュマもヒューマも 仲良くやっていたのに……
Entry.EnglishText: Not too long ago, Huma and Gajuma in this town used to get along just fine...

Entry.JapaneseText: 今じゃ、会ってもあいさつすら しなくなってしまったわ…… 何だかさびしいわね……
Entry.EnglishText: These days no one greets anyone as they pass by... It's gotten awful lonely...

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの息子、 よくふらふらと出かけてって、 なかなか帰ってこないの。
Entry.EnglishText: My son likes to wander off for long periods.

Entry.JapaneseText: もう心配するような歳じゃないけど、 親にとって子供は いつまでたっても子供なのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: He's at the age where I shouldn't worry about him going off on his own, but a parent can't help but worry...

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの子供もよくフラフラと 外に出かけるけど……
Entry.EnglishText: My son likes to wander off outside...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなた方もこんなところで、 フラフラしてないで、 早く親御さんのところにお帰りなさい。
Entry.EnglishText: You kids shouldn't follow his example. Hurry back home before you make your parents worry too much.

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの息子が バイラスに襲われて……
Entry.EnglishText: My son was attacked by Biruses...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも……ミナールから来た、 あの女の先生…… 信頼してもいいのかしら……？
Entry.EnglishText: But that doctor from Minal showed up... Can I trust a woman doctor...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマもガジュマも関係なく 診察や治療をしてくださるって言うし……
Entry.EnglishText: She said she'd provide treatment to both Huma and Gajuma equally...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたたち、キュリア先生の お手伝いをしてくださってるそうね？
Entry.EnglishText: You're helping Dr. Curia, aren't you?

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの息子の事も…… 頼みますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Please, help my son...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたのお仲間は、とても 感じのいい子たちばかりね。
Entry.EnglishText: Your friends are very good people.

Entry.JapaneseText: 特に、あの小さなお嬢さん…… とてもいい顔をしてる。
Entry.EnglishText: Especially that young lady... She has a lovely smile.

Entry.JapaneseText: 受付にいる私の息子…… ほんの少し前までは、 ヒューマを嫌ってたけど……
Entry.EnglishText: My son over at the counter used to hate the Huma until just recently...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたたちのがんばりや 優しさを見て、少しずつ 考え方が変わって来てるの。 ありがとう……
Entry.EnglishText: But seeing the kindness you displayed made him reconsider things just a little. Thank you...

Entry.JapaneseText: 色々な噂が広まって、 また街の様子がおかしく なってるわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Things have gotten dicey around here with all the rumors going around...

Entry.JapaneseText: 街を歩く時は、充分、 気をつけてね……
Entry.EnglishText: Be careful walking around the streets.

Entry.JapaneseText: みんな、以前の事を 忘れちゃったのかしら…… 静かでいい街だったのに……
Entry.EnglishText: Has everyone forgotten what peace was like? This city used to be so quiet and friendly...

Entry.JapaneseText: イヤな事もあるかもしれないけど、 楽しい事もステキな事もたくさん あったのに……
Entry.EnglishText: Sure, bad things happened sometimes, but that didn't invalidate all the wonderful things that happened.

Entry.JapaneseText: 漆黒さんたちのおかげで、 みんな少しずつ変わり始めてる。 それが嬉しくって……
Entry.EnglishText: It's wonderful! Everyone in town has started to work together thanks to the Dark Wings.

Entry.JapaneseText: 寒いですか？ 唐辛子を靴下の中に入れると、 あったまりますよ？
Entry.EnglishText: Feeling cold? Some chili peppers in your socks will warm you right up.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何が起こってるんですか？ またバイラス……？
Entry.EnglishText: What's going on? Is it the Biruses again...?

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、この前よりもっと イヤな感じがする……
Entry.EnglishText: I feel like things are going to be worse than the last incident...

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 泊まる 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Rest Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: ではまた。
Entry.EnglishText: Good day.

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>ひと晩<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが いかがですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay the night?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Will you be spending the night?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>泊まんのかい……？ <unk17:340C80>ガルド置いてきな。
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど、 泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>It's <unk17:340C80> Gald for a night. Will you be staying?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど、 泊まる？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 よろしいでしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Is that all right with you?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだ。 どうする？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Are you staying?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まりますか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Will you spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まりますか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Will you spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドで泊りますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><unk17:340C80> Gald to rest. Spend the night? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりどうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお寛ぎください。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうぞ、ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Make yourself at home.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうぞ、ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Make yourself at home.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり、どーぞー。
Entry.EnglishText: Have a good rest!

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようですね。
Entry.EnglishText: You've got no money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 金がないのに、 泊まる気だったのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: What, did you think we'd let you stay here without paying?

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないみたいね。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 泊まり賃をお持ちでないようですが。
Entry.EnglishText: It doesn't look like you can afford to stay here.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: あれ？ お金が足りないみたいだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? You seem to not have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないんじゃが……
Entry.EnglishText: It appears you don't have enough money...

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りませんが……
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money...

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足らないんですけど……
Entry.EnglishText: You don't seem to have enough money...

Entry.JapaneseText: それでは またの機会に。
Entry.EnglishText: See you next time.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またどうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ふん…… ひやかしかい……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmph... Window-shoppers...

Entry.JapaneseText: またおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back any time.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back any time.

Entry.JapaneseText: またのお越しを。
Entry.EnglishText: We hope to see you again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだ、 泊まらないのか……？
Entry.EnglishText: What, you're not going to stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでもどうぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: You're always welcome here!

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでもおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back any time.

Entry.JapaneseText: お気をつけて……
Entry.EnglishText: Take care...

Entry.JapaneseText: 泊まらないんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you not want to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Cyan>幻の庭<White>の言い伝え？ この辺りにあるのは、 人魚の伝説ぐらいですね。
Entry.EnglishText: You want to know about the <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White>? The only folktales we have around here are about mermaids.

Entry.JapaneseText: その昔、美しい人魚が、 村を襲う海の怪物を倒すために、 命を賭けて戦ったそうです。
Entry.EnglishText: The story goes that a beautiful mermaid protected this city with her life when monsters from the sea attacked.

Entry.JapaneseText: ハーフだって話もありますけど、 私はガジュマだったんじゃないか って思ってるんですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard that the mermaid was a Half, but I always felt it had to be a Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……君に恨みはないけど、 最近、ヒューマに嫌がらせを されるんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: I've got nothing against you personally, but I've been hassled by Huma a lot lately...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマと話をする気に なれないんだ……ごめんよ。
Entry.EnglishText: So I'm not really in the mood to talk. Sorry.

Entry.JapaneseText: お連れさんを悪く言うつもりは ないんですけどね……
Entry.EnglishText: I've got nothing against your companions...

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当は、ヒューマを泊めるのも 気が進まないんです……
Entry.EnglishText: But I'm not comfortable with lodging Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: この前の争いで見た、 ヒューマのあの恐ろしい顔…… 忘れられなくって……
Entry.EnglishText: I'll never forget the look the Huma had during that fight the other day...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……君に恨みはないけど、 ヒューマと話をする気には なれないんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: I've got nothing against you personally, but I'm not interested in talking with any Huma right now.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……お客さんに対して、 失礼だってわかってるんだ。 でも……ごめんよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I understand that that's poor customer service, but... Sorry.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……君、あのお医者さんの お手伝いをしてるのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Are you helping that doctor?

Entry.JapaneseText: あの先生、ヒューマばかり 治療したり……しないよね？
Entry.EnglishText: The one that...doesn't just treat Huma...?

Entry.JapaneseText: き、君……お医者さん なんだってね。
Entry.EnglishText: You're a doctor...aren't you?

Entry.JapaneseText: 君みたいな子が…… ヒューマは頭がいいって いうけど……スゴイな……
Entry.EnglishText: But you're so young... Huma really are intelligent.

Entry.JapaneseText: き、君たち……ケガした人の 手当てをしてるんだってね。 ヒューマも……ガジュマも……
Entry.EnglishText: You guys helped treat everyone... Both the Huma victims and the Gajuma victims...

Entry.JapaneseText: 君たちみたいなヒューマも いるんだな……
Entry.EnglishText: If only all Huma were like you...

Entry.JapaneseText: 手当してくれて ありがとう。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you for the treatment.
Entry.Notes: was he directly treated by Annie?

Entry.JapaneseText: つまらないものだけど、 とっておいてくれないかい。
Entry.EnglishText: It's not much, but I'd like you to have this.
Entry.Notes: does he give you something here...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 伝説の勇者が 身につけていたという鎧だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's armor that was once worn by a hero of legend.

Entry.JapaneseText: 家宝だけど、ぼくが持っていても 宝の持ち腐れ、だからさ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's a family heirloom, but I'm not exactly getting much use out of it.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたのお連れのヒューマ みたいな人ばかりなら……
Entry.EnglishText: If only everyone were like the Huma you travel with...

Entry.JapaneseText: ケンカなんてなくなるかも しれませんね……
Entry.EnglishText: Then maybe there wouldn't be any fighting.

Entry.JapaneseText: 君たちががんばった事…… 街の人たちの間でウワサに なってるよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone in town's been talking about you guys.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマを見直したって 言う人もいるそうだよ…… ぼくもそのひとりさ。
Entry.EnglishText: Some are even reconsidering their views on Huma...myself included.

Entry.JapaneseText: この前は手当してくれて ありがとう。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you for the treatment you provided.

Entry.JapaneseText: つまらないものだけど、 とっておいてくれないかい。
Entry.EnglishText: It's not much, but I'd like you to have this.

Entry.JapaneseText: 伝説の勇者が 身につけていたという鎧だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's armor that was once worn by a hero of legend.

Entry.JapaneseText: 家宝だけど、ぼくが持っていても 宝の持ち腐れ、だからさ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's a family heirloom, but I'm not exactly getting much use out of it.

Entry.JapaneseText: 女王様を処刑しようとしたヒューマって、 ガジュマ嫌いの男だったそうですね？
Entry.EnglishText: The man that tried to execute the Queen was some Gajuma hating Huma, wasn't he?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマはみんなそういう風に 思ってるんですかね……
Entry.EnglishText: Why are Huma like that...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 女王様を処刑しようとした ヒューマがいたなんて…… 信じられないよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't believe a Huma tried to execute the Queen.

Entry.JapaneseText: 君たちが悪いわけじゃないけど、 やっぱりヒューマというだけで なんだかイヤな感じがするんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: I've got nothing against you guys, but I just can't stomach Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ジルバ様がガジュマを守ると 宣言してくださったそうですね。 これで、安心して暮らせます。
Entry.EnglishText: Lady Zilva promised she would protect the Gajuma. We can finally live in peace.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……君に恨みはないけど、 ヒューマと話をする気には なれないんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: I've got nothing against you personally, but I'm not interested in talking with any Huma right now.

Entry.JapaneseText: この音と揺れが始まってから お客さんが来ない…… 何が起きてるんだろ……
Entry.EnglishText: We haven't had any customers since the ground started shaking... What's going on?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマたちには、 ガジュマとうまくやろうって 気がないんですかね？
Entry.EnglishText: Do the Huma not even want to try and coexist with us?

Entry.JapaneseText: 話さえしてくれないんです。 武力で物事は解決しないのに……
Entry.EnglishText: They won't even speak with us. Not every problem can be solved with brute force...

Entry.JapaneseText: 君たちヒューマたちには、 ガジュマとうまくやろうって 気がないのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you Huma not even want to try and coexist with us?

Entry.JapaneseText: 武力で物事は解決しないのに、 話もしようとしない……
Entry.EnglishText: You can't solve everything with brute force...

Entry.JapaneseText: 漆黒の連中は、ぼくの求めてた 答を、身をもって教えてくれた！
Entry.EnglishText: Those Dark Wing guys finally showed me the answer I've been looking for!

Entry.JapaneseText: 誰かが何かをしてくれるのを 待ってちゃダメなんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: I can't just wait for someone else to solve my problems!

Entry.JapaneseText: ダメでもいいから、 行動で気持ちを示さなきゃ！ 種族の共存のために！
Entry.EnglishText: For the sake of coexistence, we need to express our feelings in our actions! Even if others don't get it.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうですね…… 最近は雪ばかり降っていて、 やむ気配はまるでないんですよね……
Entry.EnglishText: It's been snowing nonstop lately... Doesn't look like it's going to let up anytime soon.

Entry.JapaneseText: 異常気象かな……？
Entry.EnglishText: Is this some kind of freak storm?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ノルゼン銘酒大賞・賞状』 食材屋「ママのスープ」殿 あなたが愛情をこめて作った銘酒 ワンハンドレッドロンリーは 最高の味と気品をかねそなえた 銘酒の中の銘酒です。 これを称え、ここに表彰します。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Nolzen's Finest Sake Award Certificate - The proprietors of "Mama's Soup" have created a truly breathtaking and dignified wine in One Hundred Lonely. To honor their hard work and dedication, we bestow this award.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ノルズィブーツ』 雪が苦手なお客さんに無料で 貸し出されているブーツ。 雪道でも楽々歩く事が可能で、 ノルゼンの人々は皆履いている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Nolzy Boots - Boots lent out free of charge to customers who have trouble walking on snow. They make traversing snowy roads a breeze, which is why everyone in Nolzen wears them.
Entry.Notes: feel free to change the name if you think of something more interesting sounding
